comment.body: My favorite definition of moral. Moral is just what many people agreed to think as "good", and amoral is simply what many people agreed to think as "bad". So moral is unreliable, unstable, relative. I think it is better to get smarter and smarter, learn things, and think and decide for yourself what is "good" or "bad" for you and other people around.

In russian language there are two different "moral" words most people consider as synonims. I spend about 15 minutes g??gling and didn't find good enough english words. So I will try to explain it other way. Consider there are two different types of moral: inner and outer. Yes, people tend to confuse them, but there are huge differences between inner moral and outer moral. I, for example, often against outer moral (outer moral is usual moral I told in previous comment), but I like inner moral. Let me try to define inner moral. Inner moral is when person defines global/universal rules for himself/herself and tries to stick to those rules even if it contradicts usual (outer moral). Oh, I found great article in russian about differences between those two types of moral (in russian language it is even better - they have two different words for those entities) and I think it is good idea for me to translate it into english and post it... And I did it already. So go check my translation.

I more like game "Cyberia". 1st part I completed on PSX emulator where you can save/load at any moment. It looks like there is no 2nd part for any emulator, so I didn't play 2nd part. Now I know there are two different Cyrebrias: Cyberia with "C" and Syberia with "S". I once tried "Syberia 2" with my friend who sad it is wrong Cyberia. Cyberia has episode where there is a big cooler you have to go through - hero calls it "Slice-o-matic" :-] Syberia 2 has phone on which you can dial any number you wish.
You reminded me this guy at 1:15-1:27 in https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Ih9ZM7PoBCc
hey that is that you are odd! :-]
@Callmypants: you're ze man... khm... khm... I mean, you are the cat! :-]

It is not a problem to fix. Everyone can put anyone into his/her blacklist. And there is option to "not see" posts from people who are inside that list. And you, Crackzerone, have a limit about 100K. So soon you will not be able to post your crap anymore. :-]
Doesn't work for me. I have merged english database and still "0 books found" after I refresh page. But i like idea of sharing books and name is good (Anti Library). :-]
it is true only in case there will be a battle. Till then elite will be winning all the time.
How to play your game? And pi is not diameter of any circle.

I do not remember name, but there is some short story about situation where reading is illegal! Or it was my imagination... Bah, it is not important. What I want to say reading can be something that government doesn't want to allow you. Only elite can read, other people must be stupid to be under control. Just imagine "you reading a book" is equals "you are criminal"! Even if you just able to read makes you dangerous element of society that "must be eliminated". And one of your "friend"s anytime can call the police and tell them "he can read!", making you live in constant fair. Brrrrr.... thinking about that... Just "brrrr....".

@ulrichard: Fahrenheit 451. Little by little I become interested in it. Too many times I hear something about it. I already knew there is a book and Sega-CD game. Now I know there is a movie which looks like predecessor for "Equilibrium" (where all arts including books are illegal). In that situation I think right order is 1) read the book; 2) watch the movie; 3) play the game. But first I want to finish 2MB in plain txt book I am currently reading.

@Kaffie: Congratulation with your first imposter. Number of imposters is measure of your greatness! There are some flymans in the world which are not me. They like shadows. They can't do anything in 3d, they are 2d, they have less dimensions than you. Bigger you are, more shadow(s) you cast. :-]

In terrorist training camp they treat harmed people, and in the hospital they train terrorists, or vise versa, it is so confusing... Medics in masks with huge scalpel and big injector, and brute men in masks with huge knife and big gun. How you can possibly distinguish them?

@Ranxerox: maybe, because even military intelligence is not smart enough to distinguish medic from terrorist. For example dr. House is a medic, Gordon Freeman looks more like a terrorist in his power armour suit, this youtube video shows that both are the same guy! https://youtu.be/ehCwo7BMdes

It says that I am Architect.
Wow: "Architects are simultaneously the most starry-eyed idealists and the bitterest of cynics, a seemingly impossible conflict". :-] I like to think that this is about me.
"Authority figures do not impress Architects, nor do social conventions or tradition, and no matter how popular something is, if they have a better idea, Architects will stand against anyone they have to in a bid to have it changed". Tests are fun!
